critique: The document focuses on establishing and operating America’s national system of trails, with an emphasis on cooperation between federal agencies, Tribes, States, local governments, and interested citizen groups. It aims to protect, connect, promote, and assist trails of all types throughout the United States, while also ensuring the observance of existing laws that protect lands, waters, wildlife habitats, wilderness areas, and cultural values. The order does not create any new enforceable rights and is intended for internal management of the executive branch.
